description.value:
Rite of the Totem
Mystic Rite • Level 3

Time: 8 hours
Cost: 5 Gnosis
Requirement: A willing pack, special ritual components, and access to the Umbra

Description

The Rite of the Totem is a sacred undertaking through which a pack seeks the favor of a powerful spirit. Rather than awakening a dormant entity, the Garou performing this Rite leads their companions into the Umbra so they may seek out, confront, and bargain with a spirit worthy of becoming a Totem.

A Totem is not created. It is won.

Rite Performance

When the Rite begins, the Garou performing it places ritual components over the eyelids of each willing pack member. Upon completion of this act:

  • All willing participants are temporarily phased into the Umbra, mechanically treated as the Ethereal Plane
  • The pack remains in this state as long as the performing Garou maintains the Rite
  • The transition requires no rolls and causes no strain
  • While phased, the pack may move, act, and interact normally within the Umbra

Seeking a Totem Spirit

To complete the Rite, the pack must locate and successfully negotiate with — or otherwise earn the cooperation of — a spiritual creature of CR 8 or higher. The spirit must:

  • Be willing to enter a pact
  • Be thematically appropriate as a Totem
  • Agree to inhabit a physical vessel provided by the pack

The Storyteller determines the nature of the encounter, which may involve: trials; bargains; oaths; combat; sacrifice.

Completion and Effect

Once an agreement is reached, the spirit is bound into a stationary physical vessel large enough to house it, forming a Totem.

A Totem:

  • Is a magical spiritual object
  • Cannot move or act independently
  • Retains its personality and expectations
  • May withdraw cooperation if its terms are violated

Totem Benefits

Each Totem provides two abilities, defined in the Totem section of this document: One Pack Benefit; One Personal Benefit.

To invoke a Totem's power:

  • A creature must touch the Totem
  • Activation requires 1 action
  • The creature chooses either the Pack Benefit or the Personal Benefit

Pack Benefit — Creates an aura centered on the Totem; affects allied creatures within its listed radius; only one Pack Benefit may be active at a time; effect ends as described in the Totem's entry.

Personal Benefit — Applies only to the creature that touched the Totem; effect is immediate and specific to that Totem.

Recharge: Once a Totem's power is used, it cannot be used again until after a Long Rest. Pack and Personal Benefits share the same recharge.

Limitations

This Rite:

  • Cannot be performed without a willing pack
  • Cannot bind unwilling spirits
  • Cannot create mobile or carried Totems
  • A Totem cannot be resized, carried, or merged with a creature who did not participate in the Rite
  • If the Totem vessel is destroyed, the spirit is released

"A Totem does not answer a call. It answers those who dared to come before it."
